reuo.resources

Class Resource<P extends Enum<P> & Resource.Property>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.Resource<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of properties this Resource contains
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hue, Sound

    public abstract class Resource<P extends Enum<P> & Resource.Property>
extends Object
    A data structure that contains multiple properties. Each property may be loaded independently and the resource may be queried for details on what properties are currently present. For example, you may wish to load the name of a Sound, but not the actual waveform data.

    Identifiers

    Every resource must have an identifier that should be unique to it's class. If two resources of the same class have the same identifier it may result in undefined behaviour.

    Properties

    Resources may have an arbitrary amount of properties. These properties may be loaded at any time using load(Enum, ByteBuffer). Loading a property will discard the property if it was already loaded.

    Lengths

    Each property may have either a fixed or variable length. Fixed length properties will always consume their length, even if not used. For example an ASCII String of fixed-length 20 will always take up 20 bytes even if the string was "foo" and only required 4 bytes.

    Layout

    Each property may be at a fixed position relative to the resource or at a position which is dependent on other properties. For example, if a resource contained a variable-length property A followed by a fixed-length property B, then B would be dependent on the variable-length of A.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives

        public Resource(int id)

        Parameters:

        public abstract boolean has(P property)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if a property is already loaded with this resource.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to check
        Returns:
        true if the property has been loaded
        Throws:

      • load

        public abstract void load(P property,
        ByteBuffer in)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Loads a property into this resource. If the property was previously loaded it may be discarded even if this invocation fails. The property will be read from the provided buffer from it's current position with respect to it's limit, but this does not guarantee that the position will be the limit after this invocation.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to load
        in - the buffer to read the property from
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • get

        public abstract Object get(P property)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           IllegalStateException
        Gets a previously loaded property from this resource. This method will not return null if the property was invalid; but instead will throw an IllegalStateException. You should use has(Enum) to check if the property exists before invoking this method.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to get
        Returns:
        the requested property
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the resource does not have the property
        IllegalArgumentException - if the property is not part of this resource

      • skip

        public abstract void skip(P property,
        ByteBuffer buf)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. this will no longer be needed once we do proper mapping of input buffers.
        Skips over this propery in the buffer. Afterward the position will be as if the property had been read from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to skip
        buf - the buffer to use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • hasAll

        public boolean hasAll(EnumSet<P> properties)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if the resource has all the specified properties. This is a convienence method and unless overriden will just call has(Enum) for each property.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to check
        Returns:
        true if all the properties exist in the resource
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the requested properties are invalid
